channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report E-2025040112
item.description:
Report E-2025040112

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-06
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area and 2ft-by-2ft area of asphalt and a 10ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor. They estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released most likely due to a forklift puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel inspected all 24 drums on the trailer and found only one (1) drum was affected. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum was contained in one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. Contractor personnel deployed granular absorbents to the affected areas and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040108
item.description:
Report E-2025040108

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2025, ten (10) 1-gallon cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025040161
item.description:
Report X-2025040161

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE PACKAGE FROM CALIFORNIA TO HAWAII WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX STATING TOYOTA TACOMA BATTERY POWERED RIDE ON. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A CHILDS TOYOTA TACOMA BATTERY POWERED RIDE ON WITH A NON-SPILLABLE BATTERY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. NON-SPILLABLE BATTERY IS NOT INDICATED ANYWERE ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B6V666, STARMERX INTERNATIONAL INC, 4215 E AIRPORT DR, ONTARIO CA 91761-1565.

item.title: Report X-2025040092
item.description:
Report X-2025040092

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-22
  • City: SAN PABLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 12:17 ON 3/22/2025 RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL, SAYING WAS NEEDED AT DOOR 64 ASAP. RESPONDER WENT OVER TO DOOR 64 WHERE A SUPERVISOR WAS PULLING A PACKAGE DOWN FORM THE GRATING AND PLACING IT ON A PALLET. ANOTHER EXPLAINED THAT WHILE A LOADER WAS PULLING THE PACKAGE OFF THE EXTEND IT STARTED TO SPARK FROM THE INSIDE. WHEN THIS HAPPENED, SHE DROPPED THE PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR, AND IT IMMEDIATELY CAUGHT FIRE ON ONE END. ONE END OF THE BOX WAS OPEN, AND RESPONDER COULD SEE SCORCH MARKS ON THE DEVICE INSIDE AND THE INSIDE FLAPS OF THE PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A LITHIUM BATTERY WAS BEING SHIPPED GROUND SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 16A732, ENERZ-Z, 3984 EMERALD DOWNS DR, YORBA LINDA CA 92886.

item.title: Report E-2025040109
item.description:
Report E-2025040109

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-08
  • City: VALLEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that there were seven trooper vehicles, 4 fire trucks, and CEMA personnel onsite assisting with cleanup, too. The released material impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt of the highway. Clean Harbors personnel transferred an estimated two hundred and twenty-five (225) gallons of material to a new tote using an onsite gravity transfer. The damaged and new totes were offloaded from the trailer. The contractor estimated fifty (50) gallons of Ethanol was released from the tote. There were no areas to clean in the trailer because the Ethanol had evaporated. A hazmat driver from Clean Harbors arrived to assist with taking the trailer, both totes, and waste to the West Sacramento ESTES terminal. The empty tote and the tote of product were labeled and staged in the center of the dock near 136 door. The waste generated will remain onsite for the ESTES team to coordinate disposal. It is recommended the asphalt at the site of the release should be pressure washed.

item.title: Report E-2025040101
item.description:
Report E-2025040101

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-08
  • City: KETTLEMAN CTY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0646 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a 1-gallon or less spill of UN1263, DURACOAT PRE-CATALYZED LACQUER from a 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading from terminal BAT. The spill was contained to its carton on the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill and containerizing waste into a 55-gallon DF. Per the BoL, Chemtrec was notified and provided report #2025030800026.
